segment.source: Roll Back to an Earlier Version of a GPO
segment.target: Roll Back to an Earlier Version of a GPO

segment.source: Roll Back to an Earlier Version of a GPO
segment.target: Roll Back to an Earlier Version of a GPO

segment.source: Roll Back to an Earlier Version of a GPO
segment.target: Roll Back to an Earlier Version of a GPO

segment.source: An Approver can roll back changes to a Group Policy Object (GPO) by redeploying an earlier version of the GPO from its history.
segment.target: An Approver can roll back changes to a Group Policy Object (GPO) by redeploying an earlier version of the GPO from its history.

segment.source: Deploying an earlier version of a GPO overwrites the version of the GPO currently in production.
segment.target: Deploying an earlier version of a GPO overwrites the version of the GPO currently in production.

segment.source: A user account with the Approver or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the Approver or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To deploy an earlier version of a GPO to the production environment of the domain
segment.target: To deploy an earlier version of a GPO to the production environment of the domain

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: On the Contents tab, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.
segment.target: On the Contents tab, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.

segment.source: Double-click the GPO to be deployed to display its History.
segment.target: Double-click the GPO to be deployed to display its History.

segment.source: Right-click the version to be deployed, click Deploy, and then click Yes.
segment.target: Right-click the version to be deployed, click Deploy, and then click Yes.

segment.source: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.
segment.target: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.

segment.source: In the History window, click Close.
segment.target: In the History window, click Close.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To verify that the version that has been redeployed matches the version intended, examine a difference report for the two versions.
segment.target: To verify that the version that has been redeployed matches the version intended, examine a difference report for the two versions.

segment.source: In the History window for the GPO, highlight the two versions, and then right-click and select Difference and either HTML Report or XML Report.
segment.target: In the History window for the GPO, highlight the two versions, and then right-click and select Difference and either HTML Report or XML Report.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be an Approver or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an Approver or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.

segment.source: Additional references
segment.target: Additional references

segment.target: Performing Approver Tasks
